wikipedia_page.main: Gordon Wills (24 April 1934 – 10 January 2018) was a professional footballer who played for Wolves, Notts County, Leicester City and Walsall as an attacking midfielder. He played in the Cup Winners Cup for Leicester City.

response: His management career gained more recognition at Notts County, whom he managed between October 1953 and January 1957, reaching the FA Cup quarter-finals in 1955. Former Notts County winger Gordon Wills regards Poyser as the best manager he played for. The "Magpies" struggled in the lower half of the Second Division during his four seasons at Meadow Lane, though they did reach seventh in the 1954–55 season.

link_mentions.page: List of Notts County F.C. seasons

response: *Gordon Wills, 83, English footballer (Notts County, Leicester City).Gordon Wills: 1934-2018
